definition: classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]

sentences.english: Hey, doesn't the sea look inviting?
sentences.chinese: 欸，你不觉得那海看起来很迷人吗？

sentences.english: Mike: "Well, that's because there isn't a train station in Kenting."
sentences.chinese: 欸，那是因为没有到垦丁的火车。

sentences.english: Well, damn, I guess you're right.

definition: phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
final particle expressing exhortation, admiration etc
the bleating of sheep/final particle which transforms statements into questions that indicate doubt or surprise (Cantonese)
dark reddish purple/Internet slang abbr. for 這樣子|这样子[zhe4 yang4 zi5]
(slang) alternative for 哎呦[ai1 you1] "oh my!"
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
(Internet slang) I can't even.../Are you kidding me!/OMG!
(archaic) light, bright (variant of 冏[jiong3])/(since c. 2005) (slang) emoticon signifying embarrassment, shock, helplessness etc
